title.rendered: Vaughan Home Repair: Staircase Ideas For A Small Space

content.rendered:
Stairs are an essential part of any home with a basement or second story. Unfortunately, they can also take up a lot of floor space. Find out how to save space in your home with one of these unique staircase ideas, then work with a local carpenter in Vaughan for efficient installation services. Enjoy stairs that are safe, easy to use and stylish with dependable design and installation assistance.

Spiral Staircase

The most traditional, and iconic, way to fit stairs in a small footprint is to use a spiral staircase. There’s a reason this design has been around for centuries. As each step winds its way around a center post, it climbs up to another story without taking up a long stretch of floor space.

Explore many different dimensions, materials and designs of spiral staircases to find a set that fits your home. Some offer wide, safe steps, while others use unique curves to create a modern look.

Spiral staircases may be compliant with building codes, but they can be more difficult to climb and more costly than other stair options. If you or someone in your household has difficulty with standard stairs, then a spiral staircase may not be a safe option.

Pre-made spiral staircases may be more affordable than custom open stairs, but a custom spiral design can be a significant investment. Discuss your budget with your contractor to see if you can fit the luxurious spiral staircase of your dreams or if you need to cut back on a few features for a space-saving, budget-friendly option.

Open Stairs

Open stairs can be installed in a straight length or as a spiral. With this style of staircase, the space underneath the staircase seems more open and accessible. While this design may not technically reduce the footprint of a standard set of stairs, it’s a trending design that helps your home feel more spacious.

An open design can be stylish, but it can also be a liability if improperly installed. Work with a professional for installation and repair services in Vaughan to keep your stairs safe and stylish.

Because these stairs don’t use traditional supports, you’ll likely need to pay more for them. Metal reinforcement and other components can cost more than traditional stair stringers. Ask a trusted carpenter in Vaughan for an estimate before you choose an open staircase design.

Small Stairs

Stairs to a bedroom or other living area need to comply with local building codes. If your new staircase is going to a storage area, loft or other additional space, then you can choose an even more space-saving design. Discuss small stair possibilities with a professional carpenter to minimize the disruption of your floor space.

Small stairs use slender battens and an axially supported design for a minimal footprint. You can also design them to have taller, narrower steps than a traditional staircase. These features make stairs slightly more difficult to climb, but they can significantly reduce the overall space required for stairs.

This is a popular and affordable option if you aren’t going up and down a staircase on a daily basis. For less-used areas of your home, these stairs aren’t inconvenient to use occasionally. Choose small stairs to save money on materials and installation costs.

Save Space in Your Home With Repair Services in Vaughan

Whether you’re designing a new space in your home or looking to remove a bulky staircase, it’s important to work with a qualified professional. Stay safe during your next home renovation project by working with an experienced contractor in Vaughan. Request an estimate from Handyman Connection to see how you can save space and enjoy a custom staircase in your home.
